title: Raw data and data collection time/dates for Northumberland Road baseline traffic data

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Can you indicate, as you have been listed as providing the data, for the modelling used for the traffic flow Northumberland Road project "Based on traffic data obtained in October 2018":
1) What dates and times the data was collected on
2) What the actual raw data collected is
https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/efm/teams/pr...
Yours faithfully,
James Little

Dear James Little,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Northumberland Road
which we received on 20/07/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 17/08/2023. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: James Little <[FOI #1006062 email]>
Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2023 1:56 PM
To: FOI <[Sheffield City Council request email]>
Subject: Freedom of Information request - Raw data and data collection
time/dates for Northumberland Road baseline traffic data
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Can you indicate, as you have been listed as providing the data, for the
modelling used for the traffic flow Northumberland Road project "Based on
traffic data obtained in October 2018":
1) What dates and times the data was collected on
2) What the actual raw data collected is

James Little

1 Attachment
FOI background Northumberland RDS detail.pptx
407K
Download
View as HTML
Dear James Little,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Northumberland Road
which we received on 20/07/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
The enclosed attachment shows that the data used in the modelling of the
area came from a number of different sources – not of all which is held by
Sheffield City Council.
We are able to provide information relating to ‘yellow’ sites. We are also
able to ask partners if the base data is still available to share with
you. If you are interested in this information we are happy to process
this as a new request.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [3][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: FOI

To: James Little <[FOI #1006062 email]>
